intro: Verbascum seydisehirense, commonly known as the Turkish mullein, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and tall spikes of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native range.
